|   | A bright ruby sceptre, carrying some of the powers of the arch-fiend Asmodeus. It may call forth fiery demons from their infernal home to do the wielder's bidding. |

[![Sceptre of asmodeus.png](/images/a/a6/Sceptre_of_asmodeus.png)](/File:Sceptre_of_asmodeus.png) ***the +13 sceptre of Asmodeus***

+13 [eveningstar](/Eveningstar "Eveningstar")

10% chance to summon a fire-themed [demon](/Demon "Demon") on hit  
[Evil](/Evil "Evil")

## Contents

- [1 Mechanics](#Mechanics)
- [2 Desirability](#Desirability)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Mechanics

The sceptre of Asmodeus may summon the following demons:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- 2 [![Balrug.png](/images/2/21/Balrug.png)](/File:Balrug.png) **[Balrug](/Balrug "Balrug")**: 50%
- 2 [![Hellion.png](/images/c/cf/Hellion.png)](/File:Hellion.png) **[Hellion](/Hellion "Hellion")**: 33.3%
- 1 [![Brimstone fiend.png](/images/7/72/Brimstone_fiend.png)](/File:Brimstone_fiend.png) **[Brimstone fiend](/Brimstone_fiend "Brimstone fiend")**: 16.7%

Note that the demon-summoning melee effect works only for the player. Neither Asmodeus nor your [orc friends](/Beogh "Beogh") get the summons when attacking with this weapon.

## Desirability

The **sceptre of Asmodeus**[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) is a special eveningstar that can only be obtained by killing [Asmodeus](/Asmodeus "Asmodeus"), lord of [Gehenna](/Gehenna "Gehenna"). As an evil item, the [good gods](/Good_god "Good god") frown its use.

It's a moderately good weapon. But, by the time you kill Asmodeus, you'll usually have other options available. A +9 eveningstar of [flaming](/Flaming "Flaming") / [freezing](/Freezing "Freezing") will be more consistent against non-resistant enemies. An eveningstar of holy wrath (or [sacred scourge](/Sacred_scourge "Sacred scourge")) will almost certainly perform better, assuming you can wield holy wrath.

[Hellions](/Hellion "Hellion") and [Brimstone Fiends](/Brimstone_Fiend "Brimstone Fiend") will generally avoid hurting you, e.g. they won't fire [damnation](/Damnation "Damnation") at an enemy in melee range, and the fiends won't cast [torment](/Torment "Torment") on you. However, there's no guarantee, so this item can be risky.

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), the sceptre was a +7 [staff](/Staff "Staff") that had an **A**bility to summon demons, with a chance to fail based on [Evocations](/Evocations "Evocations"). The demons were [durably summoned](/Durably_summoned "Durably summoned"), and would eventually become hostile.
- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), the sceptre could be activated from the [evoke](/V "V") menu instead of the [abilities](/A "A") menu. Also, the player needed slightly more Evocations to pass a skill check when summoning demons.
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), the sceptre could summon [sun demons](/Sun_demon "Sun demon") and [efreets](/Efreet "Efreet").
- Prior to [0.10](/0.10 "0.10"), this sceptre would fire random [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations") and summoned hostile demons when it failed to evoke properly.

## References

Sceptre of Asmodeus

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
A bright ruby sceptre, carrying some of the powers of the arch-fiend Asmodeus. It may call forth fiery demons from their infernal home to do the wielder's bidding.

the +13 sceptre of Asmodeus

+13 eveningstar

10% chance to summon a fire-themed demon on hit
Evil

Contents

  • 1 Mechanics
  • 2 Desirability
  • 3 History
  • 4 References

Mechanics

The sceptre of Asmodeus may summon the following demons:[1]

  • 2 Balrug: 50%
  • 2 Hellion: 33.3%
  • 1 Brimstone fiend: 16.7%

Note that the demon-summoning melee effect works only for the player. Neither Asmodeus nor your orc friends get the summons when attacking with this weapon.

Desirability

The sceptre of Asmodeus[2] is a special eveningstar that can only be obtained by killing Asmodeus, lord of Gehenna. As an evil item, the good gods frown its use.

It's a moderately good weapon. But, by the time you kill Asmodeus, you'll usually have other options available. A +9 eveningstar of flaming / freezing will be more consistent against non-resistant enemies. An eveningstar of holy wrath (or sacred scourge) will almost certainly perform better, assuming you can wield holy wrath.

Hellions and Brimstone Fiends will generally avoid hurting you, e.g. they won't fire damnation at an enemy in melee range, and the fiends won't cast torment on you. However, there's no guarantee, so this item can be risky.

History

  • Prior to 0.30, the sceptre was a +7 staff that had an Ability to summon demons, with a chance to fail based on Evocations. The demons were durably summoned, and would eventually become hostile.
  • Prior to 0.28, the sceptre could be activated from the evoke menu instead of the abilities menu. Also, the player needed slightly more Evocations to pass a skill check when summoning demons.
  • Prior to 0.27, the sceptre could summon sun demons and efreets.
  • Prior to 0.10, this sceptre would fire random Conjurations and summoned hostile demons when it failed to evoke properly.

References

  1. ↑ art-func.h:1806 (0.30.0)
  2. ↑ art-data.txt:361 (0.30.0)
